FuncDef:
The protected-instance command configures an ERP instance for an ERPS ring.
The undo protected-instance command deletes the configured ERP instance. The protected-instance command configures an ERP instance for an ERPS ring. The undo protected-instance command deletes the configured ERP instance. By default, no ERP instance is configured on an ERPS ring. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID1 of an ERP instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4094.
The value of instIdEnd must be greater than or equal to instId.

Specifies the ID2 of an ERP instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4094.
The value of instIdEnd must be greater than or equal to instId.

ExtraInfo: On a device running ERPS, the VLAN in which ERPS BPDUs and data packets are transmitted must be mapped to a protected instance so that ERPS forwards or blocks these packets based on rules. Otherwise, VLAN packets probably cause broadcast storms on the ring network. This will cause the network to be unavailable.
